item.title: Zephaniah 1
item.description:
Zephaniah Chapter 1

1A Message from Yahveh to Zephaniah Ben-Cushi (Ben-Gedaliah Ben-Amariah) Ben-Hezekiah at the Time of Josiah Ben-Amon, King of Judah The Coming Judgment on Judah 2“I’ll remove everything from the earth,” Yahveh says, 3“people and animals, birds in the sky, fish in the sea. I’ll destroy sinful people. 4“I’ll reach out against Judah and those who live in Jerusalem. I’ll remove the remnant of Baal from this place and the idolatrous priests,

item.title: Zephaniah 2
item.description:
Zephaniah Chapter 2

1Get together, go ahead, assemble, shameless nation,

2before the decree takes effect— before that day of repentance passes by like chaff— before Yahveh’s burning anger comes down on you.

3Look to him, you humble in the land who’ve followed his commands. Aspire to goodness and humility; maybe Yahveh will protect you when his anger comes.

Zeph 2:1-3

Judgment Against Philistia

4Gaza will be abandoned; Ashkelon, desolate. Ashdod will be driven out at midday; Ekron, uprooted.

item.title: Zephaniah 3
item.description:
Zephaniah Chapter 3

1Misfortune awaits the rebellious, defiled, tyrannical city, Jerusalem,

2that wouldn’t take advice or accept instruction, that didn’t trust in Yahveh or come near to its God.

3Its officials are roaring lions; its judges are ravening wolves at dusk that leave nothing over till morning.

4Its prophets are reckless, devious men; its priests profane the sanctuary and violate the Law.

5Yahveh is good within it; he still doesn’t do anything unjust. Every morning he hands down justice without fail, but they’re never ashamed of their unjust verdicts.
